title: Fire Island National Seashore: Work With Us
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Work With Us            Work With Us              Work With Us   There are many opportunities to work for the National Park Service. At Fire Island National Seashore a number of temporary employees are hired each year in several career fields. Summer seasonal positions are generally advertised from late January through early spring. Vacant permanent positions are occasionally announced.     Please see www.usajobs.gov or below for a list of current openings. You must be a U.S. citizen to qualify and a valid state driver's license is required for most positions.   Fire Island National Seashore also offers internships through the Student Conservation Association. Interning is a great way to gain experience in a variety of National Park Service career fields.         Current Job Opportunities Applications for jobs with the National Park Service are accepted via USAJOBS, the federal government's official source for federal job listings and employment opportunity information. The jobs listed below are drawn from USAJOBS, and clicking on any of them will take you to the detailed job announcement on USAJOBS. This list includes only jobs open to U.S. citizens. To see jobs open to eligible federal employees as well or to search for other employment opportunities, visit USAJOBS.        Lifeguard Requirements  All lifeguards must pass a pre-employment exam before applying. Tests are generally conducted during the winter or early spring.  For more information on lifeguard positions:  View a list of parks that hire lifeguards and pay rates. Call 1-800-678-7946.
